translated: Verses of the Elders
The Elevens🔽The First Chapter
Saṅkicca
“What is your purpose in the forest, dear?
You are like a cloud in the rainy season.
Verambhā is delightful to you,
for seclusion is for one who meditates.”
“Just as the wind in the rainy season
drives away the clouds,
so perceptions drive away my perceptions,
which are in conformity with seclusion.
The one without spots, born from an egg,
wandering in the Sīvathikā charnel ground;
he arouses my mindfulness,

analyzed: sandehasmim virāga nissita  yañca aññe na rakkhanti
translated: which is based on non-attachment in the midst of doubt.🔽He who does not protect others
and whom others do not protect,
that monk sleeps well,

analyzed: kāmesu anapekkhavā  acchodikā puthusilā  gonaṅgulam igāyutā
translated: without concern for sensual pleasures.🔽The clear-flowing river, the flat rock,🔽the herds of deer and antelope,
covered with a carpet of moss—
those mountains delight me.
I have lived in the wilderness,
in caves and mountain grottoes,
in secluded resting places,
frequented by wild beasts.
‘May they be killed! May they be destroyed!
May they experience pain! May they perish!’
I do not recall any such thought,
unworthy, full of hate.
I have served the Teacher,
I have done what the Buddha asked.
The heavy burden is laid down,
The fetters that bound me are destroyed.
The purpose for which I went forth
from the house to the houseless life
Has been achieved by me,

analyzed: sabba sa yojana kkhayo  na abhinandāmi maraṇa
translated: the destruction of all fetters.🔽I do not delight in death,
I do not delight in life;
I await the time,

analyzed: nibbisam bhatakaḥ yathā  na abhinandāmi maraṇa
translated: like a hired worker.🔽I do not delight in death,
I do not delight in life;
I await the time,
mindful and clearly comprehending.”
… The elder Saṅkicca …
The group of eleven is finished.🔽The summary:
The elder Saṅkicca is the only one,
his task done, without defilements.
In the group of eleven,
there are eleven verses.
